mains

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • mains.Model

  • public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
    Only class representing model from MVC, getting information from SQL database. It connects only with controllers, not with view. All controllers have reference to model. There is one object of this class created during all program instance, created in first line of Main.
    Since:
    2018-06-03
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Wojciech Sitek

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Model.UserType
      Public internal enum class, indicating which is the type of user, that has logged in.

    • Field Detail

      • conn

        private java.sql.Connection conn
        Parameter type Connection, established during logging or registering and being closed after signing out. Almost all methods in this class use this parameter.

      • userType

        private Model.UserType userType
        Private parameter of type Model.UserType, keeping information about type of user: either admin, or student, or teacher.

      • me

        private Person me
        Parameter keeping the reference of person, that is logged in. It is either an instance of class Student or of class Teacher.

      • lastId

        private int lastId
        Integer used in showing parts of sets of people or groups. It indicates last id of person or group that was shown.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Model

        public Model()

    • Method Detail

      • checkUser

        Model.UserType checkUser(java.lang.String mail,
                         java.lang.String enteredPassword)
                  throws ConnException,
                         java.sql.SQLException

        Method checks if mail and password are in the database and initialises userType parameter.

        Method checkUser gets information from the database tables (Teachers, Students and Admins) and compares it with data given by user (mail and password).

        Method implemented in this class method openConnection

        Parameters:
        mail - e-mail adress entered by user in the InitialView
        enteredPassword - pass entered by user in view
        Returns:
        type of user (enum) - admin, teacher or student. On this depends type of downloaded data and consequently view
        Throws:
        ConnException - informs InitController module about type of error occuring (connection with database, wrong mail, wrong password)
        java.sql.SQLException - if the process of connection with database breaks, then this exception is thrown
        See Also:
        logIn(String, String)

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Closes connection with database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong with closing connection, the exception is thrown
        See Also:
        signOut()

      • openDatabaseConnection

        private void openDatabaseConnection()
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Opens connection with database, initialising conn.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong with opening connection, the exception is thrown

      • logIn

        public void logIn(java.lang.String mail,
                  java.lang.String pass)
           throws ConnException
        Logs in the user, given mail and password. First checks if this user is a hacker by method isHacker(String), then opens database connection, checks if this user exists by method checkUser(String, String) and finally gets from SQL tables information about student or teacher.
        Parameters:
        mail - e-mail, unique in SQL tables, identifies user
        pass - checked by method checkUser(String, String), if is correct, cannot be hacking.
        Throws:
        ConnException - if something goes wrong, this exception is thrown to InitController

      • isWaitingInDatabase

        private boolean isWaitingInDatabase(java.lang.String type)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                    ConnException
        Checks if this type, which we want to add to Waiting table for administrator check, is just waiting connected with this user, in table Waiting.
        Parameters:
        type - String value, can be one of the types that can wait in database for admin check: name, student_id, etc.
        Returns:
        returns true, if this value is just waiting in database and false if not
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.
        ConnException - if something goes wrong with data given by user

      • isMailInDatabase

        private boolean isMailInDatabase(java.lang.String mail)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Checks if mail, that someone wants to occupy, isn't in database - in tables Teachers, Students or Waiting.
        Parameters:
        mail - e-mail, which occurrence is checked in database. Cannot contain forbidden chars like '," or ;
        Returns:
        returns true, if mail is just in one of these databases.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.

      • register

        public void register(java.lang.String mail,
                     java.lang.String pass)
              throws ConnException
        Tries to register new user, checking and taking his mail and password into Waiting table, waiting for admin check.
        Parameters:
        mail - e-mail that is first checked by method isHacker(String), then by method isMailInDatabase(String) and finally inserted into Waiting table.
        pass - e-mail that is first checked by method isHacker(String) and then inserted into Waiting table together with mail.
        Throws:
        ConnException - if something goes wrong with data given by user.

      • getMe

        public Person getMe()
        Get method.
        Returns:
        Returns me.

      • getUserType

        public Model.UserType getUserType()
        Get method.
        Returns:
        Returns userType.

      • signOut

        public void signOut()
        Method for signing out of the database. Closing connection and setting values of me and userType to null.

      • changePass

        public void changePass(Person person,
                       java.lang.String newPassword)
                throws java.sql.SQLException,
                       ConnException
        Updates indicated person's password. If data is wrong, throws some exceptions.
        Parameters:
        person - Person, whose password is going to change.
        newPassword - String indicating new password.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.
        ConnException - if something goes wrong with data given by user.

      • isHacker

        public static boolean isHacker(java.lang.String value)
        This static method checks if parameter contains forbidden for SQL queries characters which may hack the database, like ' " or ;
        Parameters:
        value - checked String value
        Returns:
        Returns true if value is 'hacking'

      • update

        private void update(Person person,
                    java.lang.String value,
                    java.lang.String field)
             throws java.sql.SQLException,
                    ConnException
        This private method updates given by parameters values in the tables - Students or Teachers.
        Parameters:
        person - Person, whose data are to be changed.
        value - New value, to which data is to be set.
        field - SQL name of field, that is going to be changed.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.
        ConnException - if something goes wrong with data given by user.

      • changeMail

        public void changeMail(Person person,
                       java.lang.String mail)
                throws java.sql.SQLException,
                       ConnException
        Changes person's mail, using method update(Person, String, String), after checking if new mail for sure is not in the database.
        Parameters:
        person - Person, whose mail is going to be changed.
        mail - New mail.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.
        ConnException - if something goes wrong with data given by user.

      • changeStudentID

        public void changeStudentID(Student student,
                            int student_id)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException,
                            ConnException
        Changes student's student id, using method update(Person, String, String) and setting new student id to Student.
        Parameters:
        student - Student, whose student id is going to be changed
        student_id - new value of student id.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.
        ConnException - if something goes wrong with data given by user.

      • changeName

        public void changeName(Person person,
                       java.lang.String name)
                throws java.sql.SQLException,
                       ConnException
        Changes name of person. It is used only by admin, because students and teachers can only ask for change of their names.
        Parameters:
        person - Person, whose name is going to be changed.
        name - New value of name.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.
        ConnException - if something goes wrong with data given by user.

      • changeGenGroup

        public void changeGenGroup(Student student,
                           java.lang.String genGroup)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException,
                           ConnException
        Changes general group of student in SQL database.
        Parameters:
        student - Students, whose genGroup is going to be changed.
        genGroup - new value of genGroup.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.
        ConnException - if something goes wrong with data given by user.

      • askForChange

        public void askForChange(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String type)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException,
                         ConnException
        Inserts query with new value into Waiting SQL table, asking admin for check and update. Person is always me.
        Parameters:
        name - New value.
        type - Type of value, corresponding with table column name.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.
        ConnException - if something goes wrong with data given by user.

      • getGroupIdByName

        public int getGroupIdByName(java.lang.String groupName)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException,
                            ConnException
        Gets group id, while given its name.
        Parameters:
        groupName - Name of Group.
        Returns:
        This group id.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.
        ConnException - if something goes wrong with data given by user.

      • createGroup

        public void createGroup(Group group)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException,
                        ConnException
        Creates new group with given data. It is assumed that checking for duplicates was done before.
        Parameters:
        group - necessary data for setting up new group in database, kept in object of class Group.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.
        ConnException - if something goes wrong with data given by user.

      • addGroup

        public void addGroup(Person person,
                     int groupId)
              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Adds person to a group.
        Parameters:
        person - Person added to group.
        groupId - Id of group, to which person is going to be added.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.

      • getStudents

        public java.util.ArrayList<Student> getStudents(int showingState,
                                                Group group)
                                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Used in AttendanceTakingController, method gets students from given group from database.
        Parameters:
        showingState - increased one by one int, indicating which part of students set is shown (there can be max 27 students at once).
        group - Group of origin of all students taken by this method.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Students, max of size 27.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.

      • takeAttendance

        public void takeAttendance(java.util.ArrayList<Student> students,
                           Group group)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Inserts given data into attendance.
        Parameters:
        students - set of students with information about their attendance.
        group - Group of origin of these students.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.

      • getGroups

        public java.util.ArrayList<Group> getGroups(int showingState)
                                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method gets max 27 groups from SQL database.
        Parameters:
        showingState - increased one by one int, indicating which part of groups set is shown (there can be max 27 groups at once).
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Groups, max of size 27.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.

      • getAttendance

        public java.util.ArrayList<Student> getAttendance(Group group)
                                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Used in AttendanceController, gets information about student's attendance.
        Parameters:
        group - Group of origin of students.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Students with information about their attendance. There can be duplicates of students, because each attendance set gets their student.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.

      • updateAttendance

        public void updateAttendance(java.util.ArrayList<Student> students,
                             Group group)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Updates information about attendance in given group.
        Parameters:
        students - updated set of students with information about their attendance.
        group - group of origin of all students in parameter before.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getPeople

        public java.util.ArrayList<Person> getPeople(boolean onlyStudents)
                                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Gets students or teachers connected with this student or teacher. For admin, it gets all students or all teachers.
        Parameters:
        onlyStudents - boolean indicating (for admin), if they want students (true) or teachers (false). The rest of users can get only students or only teachers.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of people being students or teachers.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.

      • addPerson

        public void addPerson(Person person)
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Adds new person to database.
        Parameters:
        person - information about this person kept in class Person.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.

      • getTimetable

        public java.util.ArrayList<Group> getTimetable()
                                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Gets groups of this student or this teacher.
        Returns:
        ordered by time ArrayList of Groups
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong in connection with database.
